welcome.title: Welcome to Topple Scorer!
welcome.content: This tutorial will guide you through the game. You can skip it anytime or come back later.

setup.title: Game Setup
setup.content: Start by configuring your game: select number of players (2-4), set victory points, and customize player names and colors.

rolling.title: Rolling Dice
rolling.content: Click the dice icon or "Roll Dice" button (or press Space/Enter) to roll. The number determines where you can place pieces.

placing.title: Placing Pieces
placing.content: After rolling, valid cells are highlighted in blue. Click a highlighted cell to place your piece there.

scoring.title: Scoring
scoring.content: Score points by completing rows, adding to completed rows, or building tall stacks (3+ pieces). Scores update automatically.

topples.title: Topples
topples.content: If pieces fall, click "Topple Occurred". The last player to have placed a piece loses 10 points, and their previous player gains 3 bonus points.

controls.title: Game Controls
controls.content: Use the Menu button for undo, reset, and settings. Keyboard shortcuts: Space/Enter (roll), U (undo), R (reset), Esc (close dialogs).

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.content: Check the Analytics Dashboard to see dice roll frequencies, average scores, and game statistics.

help.title: Help
help.objectiveDescription: Score the most points by completing or adding to stacks or rows of playing pieces, while being careful not to topple any of the other pieces.
help.preparation1: Set up the TOPPLE Board on a flat surface by placing the stand into the base and balancing the TOPPLE tower on top of the stand.
help.preparation2: Add players in the order they're sitting in a circle, assign them colors and give each player all the playing pieces (12 pieces) of that color. In case of 2 players, each player can choose 2 colors.
help.preparation3: Determine the number of victory points you want to play for.
help.initialDiceRollDescription: Press Roll Dice to roll the dice to determine the starting player. In case of a tie, we roll again. Highest roll goes first. Then play continues clockwise.
help.duringGameDescription: For each turn, roll dice by either pressing the Roll Dice button or by pressing the Space or Enter key. Then place a piece on the board by clicking on a valid placement location. If any player causes a topple, mark it by clicking the Topple Occurred button. The last player to have placed a piece will lose 10 points, and their previous player will gain 3 points.
help.scoring1Description: If you place a piece that completes a row of five pieces in any direction (horizontally, vertically or diagonally), you score 3 points for completing the row plus 1 point for each playing piece of your color that tops each other stack in that row, and not all other rows.
help.scoring2Description: If you add a piece to a completed row of five, you score 1 point for each piece of your color that tops each stack in that row, and not all other rows.
help.scoring3Description: If you add a piece to a stack that already has three or more pieces high, you score 1 point for each piece of your color in that stack, and not any other stack.
help.scoring4Description: You can score multiple points if you place a piece that completes or adds to more than one row, or which stacks more than three high and completes or adds to a row. The piece that you play that is common to different rows or to a stack and a row, is counted for each row and/or stack.
help.remember1: Players cannot touch the TOPPLE board or any of the pieces already placed on the board.
help.remember2: If you accidentally knock the board, or table, and cause a topple, whether or not it's your turn, you lose 10 points.
help.winningDescription: A round ends when a topple has occurred or when all the pieces have been played. If a topple has not occurred during a round, the pieces are removed from the board and the scoring and play continue. Even if a player reaches the required number of points during a round, the game is not over until all the pieces have been played or a topple has occurred. If more than one player reaches the required number of points at that time, the player with the highest total points wins.
